p: That praxis would mean dismantling the monocultures and monoliths of a broken food system and siloed priorities that assumes that “big” always means “better.” It would also forge joint policy frameworks for preparing for and preventing future pandemics that span human societies and the nonhuman world. Such collaborations could occur within and among academic institutions (faculty, researchers, and students), international bodies (such as the World Health Organization and the UN Environment Programme), policy makers (at global, national, and subnational levels), and civil society organizations.
